Почалося все з того, що в лаунчері треба було ввеси код активації гри. Увага: хоч хтось пам'ятає ігри де це треба було робити? В моїй пам'яті наближча гра де треба був код це Two Worlds що вийшла в 2007 (чи 2008), але окей, я погуглив, і знайшов форум від 19го року де писали:"треба запустити перевірку файлів", я подумав що це якась туфта і в тубу рестартнувв лаунчер і-о чудо воно підтягнуло ключ активації, потім я зв'язав раніше зареєстрований обліковий запис цієї контори з записом Стіма. Мене трохи смутило що мова англійська, бо я вибрав російську в налаштуваннях, але це нінащо не вплинуло, на моє здивування-для вибору мови треба було нажати на свій профіль цієї контроти в лаунчері, і вже там в налаштування вибрати мову, це дивно. Потім запустилась гра, "УРА!"-подумав я, "ФІГУШКИ"-сказала гра, повтикав в чорний екран, і почалася компіляція шейдерів і ще якоїся туфти, але це було швидке (пара хвилин-не більше). Потім було створення персонажа, в 720р... з включеним FSRом... і лише створивши персонажа в цьому замиленому милом милі нарешті можна було відкрити налаштування, і вибрати нормальну графіку, але ні, щоб відкрити налаштування роздільної здатності треба було нажати на маленький плюсик, можливо це і логічно для когось але не для мене. Налаштувавши графоній нарешті нажав "грати" і... МИШКА І КЛАВІАТУРА НЕ ПРАЦЮВАЛИ, я погуглив, і як оказалось, форуми від 19го року мені підказали що треба вибрати мишку і клавіатуру як первинні пристрої вводу, бо чомусь у мене там стояв геймпад. Окей, геймпад-подумав я, взяв геймпад, АЛЕ ВІН ТАКОЖ НЕ ДАВАВ НІЯКИХ КОМАНД ГРІ. Я подумав що він розрядився (хоча світлодіод працював) і перевірив в якійся софтині його, і він команди давав. Отже гра просто не бачила його, крутяк! Вибравши в налаштуваннях клавіатуру і мишу як первинні пристрої вводу-все запрацювало, дякую! І тут почалося навчання, і воно на диво було добре зроблено. Окрім одного моменту де треба було перемкнути режим інструмента. Може я додік і десь було сказано що це на "К" (англ "R"), але я не бачів не у підказках, ніде, може це було буквально сказано і я пропустив крізь вуха, а може ні. Пройшовши навчання, мене трохи здивувала система бою, бо інтутлаг такий, ну... я не знаю як його описати, він був але його не було, просто коли до цього бродив по комплексу я не відчував інпутлаг, а потім він з'явився, може це якесь згладжування рухів було, може ні, я не знаю. І тут момент з "потрапити на корабель" (тут вже виключно я додік бо все було написано) але у мене виникли проблеми, в хвості корабля були ворота і місток, я подумав "мені туди", але ні, не туди, потім підійшовши до носа корабля костюм почав заряджатися, я оглянувся і побачів підйом нагору, але ні, мені не туди, мені треба було натистуни "К" (англ "R") щоб потратипи на борт. І повтикавши ще в чорний екран (а гра на м2 стоїть, чи то кукуруза 1600х не витянгує?) мені показали приземлення на якусь холодну планету. І викинули в меню. Відсутнє з'єднання з серверами Фронтіру. Крутяк подумав я. і...
оформив рефанд.

184472675.review:
Let me tell you about one of my favorite games that I have played on and off for many years.

1) The game is visually stunning. Even the most desolate rocks out in the universe still look amazing, and the sky-box is down right mesmerizing, with every star in the sky actually moving positions in the sky as you move from start system to start system.
2) The game is massive, a complete 1:1 scale of the Milky Way Galaxy. If you ever wanted to travel to Sagittarius A and see the black hole at the center of the universe, you can do so; just expect to take a few hours of flight time to get there because it ain't close. (To set expectations though, black holes in the game are the one thing lacking visually and I hope one day they re design them)
3) The game has a lot to do. Want to be a bounty hunter? Go do it! Want to be a pirate? Go do it! You want to mine ore from asteroids and/or haul thousands of tons of materials or trade goods across the galaxy in a massive fleet carrier? Go do it!

On top of all the above, we are getting the ability to colonize new star systems soon which will give the players the ability to build (pre-designed) space stations and star ports in currently unoccupied systems, bringing a whole new way to play the game in 2025; not to mention the possibility that a new alien conflict is likely to happen in the future after we start expanding outward so there is that to look forward to as well.

If I have to give one caveat about the game, it's that the game has no structure. It is a sandbox game through and through, so if the idea of coming up with your own objectives in an open ended game doesn't sound like fun to you, you may want to stay away. Otherwise, if that all sounds great to you, welcome to the galaxy commander! o7

184464559.review:
An open galaxy phenomenon. It goes way past an open world, way past a living world,  beyond a sandbox in almost all aspects short of a few things. It is a world class flying and space simulator with bustling markets and stations which - most of you can explore on foot now. It lets you be in any role you want, pledge to any faction, or even fight aliens.
Graphics - 6/10 slightly outdated
Sound - 10/10 listen to those engines
Story - debatable if there even is one?
Physics - 9/10 you can even blackout from g forces

Your galaxy your choices. It's not a dialogue based game but it's a role based game. There is a story and lore but it's not as obvious to find it. Part of the story comes back around to secret organizations (players still searching to this day), secret experiments, and aliens. What will hit you first in terms of story is the obvious power play which is your pledge to factions which helps shape the galaxy and known systems.

They have long supported this game and unlike Star Citizen, it's a fully released game with the promises they've made. Even adding more all the time. It's more realistic than No Mans Sky, although perhaps not as deep with species and discovery.

What this game could use more of? Better textures perhaps, businesses, income possibilities. They are adding colonization of star systems but it would be nice to be able to own your own shops for passive income. There are fleet carriers, but most players seem to avoid them because so many don't have what you need and when they do - they set theIr own prices whereas it's easier to travel somewhere for 2 minutes for 1/10th the price. Also, you often never know what a fleet carrier has for sale or purchase before visiting it.

Aside from that, I would absolutely recommend this labor of love.

184309844.review:
The game is fun but unless you REALLY enjoy alt-tabbing every 5 minutes to go google what you're doing, This game isn't for you. The game has several complex systems overlaid on top of each other to simulate a space-exploration sim but really you're managing a heads up display and a star chart as well as 30 different reddit/wiki tabs. 

The only tutorial the game provides you with is how to fly and how your guns work in groundside combat, which is fine if the information for LITERALLY anything else was inside of a menu in game or if windows had an optional help button for navigation. Instead you're required to fumble around with a single save-slot to your account, all of the cosmetics are tied to the earnable end game currency - which also resets between character, and potentially just waste 40 hours before you actually have a concept of an understanding of what to do in this game. There are two kinds of people who play elite dangerous, People who enjoy space-exploration simulation games, and people who enjoy reading reddit threads. You cannot go into this game with prior experience of another simulation game because most of the rules are thrown out the window for arbitrary complex systems that aren't present in most other space faring sims. If you want my brutally honest opinion - If you just want to explore a universe, pick up no mans sky. If you're into the brutal economy and large-scale intergalactic corporate warfare, Go play EVE. This game is for very specific people and it shows by the stark difference in peoples' play time. Your friends who own this game either have 400+ hours or 40 minutes.

184265527.review:
Ah, yes - Elite Dangerous: the loading-screen simulator with extra steps. The game focuses on exploration, offering over 400 billion star systems. But the catch is that about 98% of them are lifeless, boring, and repetitive.

Picture this: You’re excited to embark on a journey and uncover the galaxy’s secrets. You make a jump and find a system with a few metallic and rocky planets plus a gas giant - cool. Then you make another jump, and another: the 5th, the 10th, the 50th, the 100th… and it’s basically the same stuff every time. All these planets are essentially reskins of one another, with minimal color variation and zero unique features. There’s nothing happening on the surface—everything’s a lifeless desert. They didn’t even bother adding basic events like auroras! And space itself is just as empty—there’s nothing going on anywhere.

You might think the Odyssey DLC, with its atmospheric planets, would add some variety. Wrong! They’re the same dull planets but with a bit of sky. There’s no real flora or fauna - just maybe a few plants here and there.

However, don’t get me wrong. There are indeed some truly amazing and breathtaking places in the galaxy. The game can be beautiful in the right spots, but most of those are so far away that traveling there feels like a tedious hyperspace grind. For me, exploration isn’t worth the hassle; it starts to feel like a chore.

What I do like is the overall aesthetic of the game. They nailed the ship handling, and the sound design is pure bliss to my ears. The combat system is also solid - PvP is fun, and hunting Thargoids (the hostile alien civilization) is especially thrilling.

So why did I give the game a positive review if most of my comments are negative? Personally, I don’t want to trash the game entirely. It’s good at what it does, and if it keeps making money, the developers can hopefully keep expanding it with amazing updates and content.

P.S. I have a low number of hours on record because this is a new account. I sold my old one a while back, but recently decided to revisit the game.

184239042.review:
I remember putting hundreds of hours into Elite 2 - Frontier back in the day. It is prehistoric looking by today's standards, old looking when it came out, but the emergent gameplay was incredible. I've been putting off playing Elite Dangerous because I knew for sure it would be the only game I would ever play for a long time. Sadly, it didn't work out that way.

I picked it up with the Odyssey dlc, and the jank started there. Dropped into the Odyssey starter mission, the game tried to show me a taste of what was to come -  a very, very mediocre FPS experience, with a fiddliness I'd expect from setting up a domino run, and a middling visual quality that did not support the performance. On finishing the mission, I eventually ended up at the starter hub. 

I took a break, and came back to the game, and tried the tutorial instead of continuing. This was the Elite I knew and space flight was interesting and detailed. So I continuted my game, and was told to start the tutorial. Which I had just finished. I could skip it, but this is not a greate on-boarding experience for new gamers - even for ones who have some idea waht's exptected of them.

I eventually got to fly a space ship wherever the hell I wanted, and that felt so right. I didn't have a clue what I should start with, so I picked a job at random and went for it. I suspected if I had given it enough time, I would have found something to move the plot forward, but i didn't care. Elite always was about making your mark in the game. And at this aspect, Elite Dangerous excels.

Unfortunatley, while playing on SteamDeck is very doable, and performs well, ED is a game that needs to be connected to the internet at all times to work, even if you've chosen to play in a solo (with no other players) galaxy. That's unfortunate because when you put your Steamdeck to sleep, you disconnect. When you turn it back on, you'll get to play for a minute before an error appears, and the game kicks you back to the main menu. While the game is listed as "playable", I would argue if it cannot support a basic feature of portable gaming, then it really isn't. If you save and quit every time you want to stop playing, you'll probably have no issues. It's incredible this is even a problem, even Disney's Dreamlight Valley supports sleep mode, and a literal MMO The Elder Scrolls Online is fine with it. The in-game FSR is also so terrible it makes text illegible.

So I can't play it much more. I don't have a gaming machine, so the SteamDeck is what I have, and the game won't work well with it. The inclusion of in-game currency gives me a bad feeling also.

Okay I put a few hours in and I think I finally understand the basics. Steep learning curve but super rewarding, as any good simulator is. And it is. A simulator, that is. Everything from the map to the flight controls (I use a stick and thrust mechanism) to the economy is simulated to an intimidating degree. Luckily you have faster than light travel, a truly impressive bindings menu, and INARA (google it if you don't know) to help with those challenges.

Good game. New fave. 10/10 would mine platinum for hours and buy a beefed up turreted Type-10 again.

184200621.review:
In the name of a life long childhood search for a proper space experience, I have played; Spacebourne 2, Everspace 2, Ixion, Starfield, No Mans Sky, Star Citizen, Starbound, Star Trek Online, Star Wars the Old Rebuplic, Spore and Spore Galactic Adventures, Eve Online, Warframe, Subnautica(I know not technically a space sim-but I have my reasons its on this list), Astroneer, Boundless, Destiny 2 and Before We Leave.

No Mans Sky, is probably the most enjoyable as in its ease, its reminds me of a more real Adults Astroneer and has a good sense of adventure with not a movie like story but a solid questing base to fill you characters narrative.
Star Citizen is more for the hardcore realistic first person survival enthusiast boasting continuity being able to enter planets and exit your ship with no loading screens and is more for playing with the community and friends, but is a Hot mess.
Elite is complex with no story and no sense of real adventure, its more like finding your place in a real open world economy and working a 9 to 5 in space. 
SpaceBourne2 has a good story but is Janky.
Everspace2 is the most complete story driven game here, but is more limited to that path in the world.

Of ALL of them, Elite is by far the best open world experience, if you want gritty hard realism, with the what feels like the most realistic functions and world design.

First the ships dash systems are absolutely amazing, where all the elements of the Dash UI are functioning screens reading out real data your ship is intaking, unlike No Mans Sky. Now I do like being able to run around the ship in Star Citizen, but I just cant with that game, raised 700k and still cant even get mesh collision working, but can expand their front store over and over, bah, Elite Dangerous give a complete experience with many jobs missions and roles. Easy Cargo hauls or intense dogfights. The ships also handle amazing, they are so much like handling a real vehicle, that they take some real learning to get down, cant just fly it around all crazy like other space games, its control design causes it to move and react more like a piece of heavy machinery. I also love the way the UI is the Characters UI as much as its the Players. And they though of everything, I was caught cargo full, way over power drain, pirate came for my haul, over 400k in illicit goods, couldnt engage my weapons cuz it caused me to go over my power limit, then life support would go off and shields would go down and after 1 shot the weapons power was drained too. Then I remembered this game gives the legit access to your modules mid-flight on one of your cockpit panels, went in, deactivated modules I didnt need, got the  power I needed and went from suffocating, getting shot at, almost losing my haul and my life, to whoopin dudes "A" and making my delivery just in time ! That level of stranded in space, with only my ingenuity and knowledge to survive, like some Apollo 13 Shht forreal !

Also the Ground fighting is way more clean and solid than I expected, by a long shot. Straight up great FPS quality, when I was afraid it would feel like an after thought.

Now having said that, all the games Ive played have their merit, but lets talk about what sucks about Elite, Its REAL> and because its so raw, its hard. Whats more is, it has a complex world and system, with very little tutorial, The Training they do have, however.. is a crucial must, which I never do training and tutorials, but this game, you really need to. In fact in this game, you can die for landing on or loitering over the wrong landing pad. Its REALLY best to practice, ESPECIALLY Driving your ship, as if mastering the motion of a real vehicle, doing the flight training over and over like a 15 year old in the station wagon in a parking lot. And the main problem, there is no good references online. Even videos made by most content creators are showy but lack substance. So its hard to find places to learn from, my first 4 days were filled with endless hours of searching and watching and trying the hard way in game. Bottom line, this game might have one of the hardest learning curves with the least support out there. That being said, its so good, I was determined to make it work. Then after a while a series of break throughs and lots of research payed off. Once you figure it out, its easy as pie. Its starting thats super hard.

With that in mind, let me say what helps, Start with Data transport and small cargo runs to make money, YOU can make anywhere from 33k to 400k from these, I tend to stick to the 130k or higher runs. Second, find a place to get modules and get the Fuel Scoop and the Auto Docking Mechanism. These make it free to jump immediately from system to system refilling at each sun as you pass allowing you to travel infinite distances without stopping at a station, and the auto dock makes it much easier to land and take care of business if you do need to stop and get back going again.

183922823.review:
He decidido escribir esta reseña después de más de 1000 h. jugadas y teniendo una segunda cuenta.
Creo que puedo asegurar que es uno de mis juegos favoritos. No por nada, es el juego que más horas marca en mi biblioteca.
Tenéis que tener en cuenta que es y pretende ser un simulador serio. Teniendo en cuenta que no puede simular nada, ya que aún no disponemos de tecnología similar, el manejo de las naves se siente muy real a los mandos. Puedes notar las diferencias entre las distintas naves y puedes sentir cómo el volumen, tamaño y peso de las naves te obligan a pilotar diferente. Los diferentes componentes con los que puedes equipar estas naves hacen que se comporte de forma diferente. Dejando un poco de lado la sensación a los mandos, los ciclos solares de los planetas, las distancias, las órbitas, la gravedad diferente en cada planeta se ha diseñado siguiendo patrones reales que puedes notar y sentir. De verdad sientes que estás ahí.
Sobre el gameplay, no es juego muy amigable al principio, pero tampoco te lo pone difícil. Digo que no es amigable porque no vas a encontrar misiones de historia que te digan qué hacer o por donde empezar o continuar. Eres tú en todo momento el que tiene que decidir qué hacer y a qué dedicarte. y aunque al principio no lo parezca, tienes muchas cosas diferentes que poder hacer. Mi mejor consejo es ser paciente ya que no vas a conseguir nada de forma rápida pero es igual de disfrutable desde el minuto 1. Este juego no tiene end game, por lo que el objetivo es el que tú te marques.
Estás en un universo vivo en el que ocurren cosas en las que puedes decidir participar o no. Depende de ti. Puedes ver como tus acciones importan y modifican situaciones, aunque en muy pequeña escala, claro. La galaxia es enorme (escala 1:1 con la vía láctea).
Recomiendo este juego al 100% y en medida de lo posible, recomiendo jugarlo con un HOTAS o HOSAS. La inmersión cambia mucho y es de lo mejor que ofrece el juego.

183901568.review:
I can not believe I have had this gem in my game library all this time!
Perhaps, some of my experience sums up many experiences of others with regards to Elite Dangerous

I have known about Frontier Developments for years, when I first tried, unsuccessfully, to apply for job there, I currently work in the same town as FDev, just a few buildings down in the same office park. Not knowing much about their games, my first encounter with Elite Dangerous was at a game convention in London, where their marketing team was there to demo their CQC mode in VR.
 At the time, I thought "OK, its a VR game with some nice SFX, but not my thing". That was because I went in my first session thinking I was playing a space action game, where you just mindlessly blast things.

 Fast-forward a year or two, and I finally buy the game around the time Horizons comes out.. where it sits unplayed for another year or so.. due to my huge Steam game library backlog.
 I finally get around to playing it around the time of Odyssey release, where this time I realize my first impression of the game were wrong but... I am still not convinced.. because the game feels empty and repetitive with the same generated missions showing up at stations. This left me with the same feeling that I am just playing an action game with not much to do. So I put the game down for yet another year or so.

 Then suddenly, after looking for something to scratch a space itch I was having. I try Elite Dangerous again.. this time with PATIENCE. Like I had all of time in the world, ready to soak up the hours of YouTube videos ahead of me with unwavering determination. I finally start making achievements in the game, and with each I start getting more and more hooked. I finally...
 - Fine-tune my flight controls, and stop crashing into stations (the mailboxes)
 - Start to thoroughly understand my ship fittings
 - Finally make an effort to understand the universe map and all the various icons
 - Start getting into all of the disciplines (Mining, Trading, Bounty Hunting, Exploration, etc.)
 - Learn engineering
 - Read GalNet and start making sense that there more than meets the eye, the news actually matters
 - Start realizing this is a universe and is heavily narrative-driven
 - Discover the amazing community and join up with Anti-Xeno Initiative to face off in Xeno battles
 - Start making my own goals, like build up money for a fleet carrier and plan a first trip to Colonia

 I must admit I was very wrong about this game for years. Elite Dangerous is not an space action game, it is actually a sandbox about curiosity, exploration and discovery. The action is just a small part of what is a massive game with so much to do!

 Now.. on to see if I can get a job at FDev to push out some updates just a tad faster... Hi there FDev! I like your game! :]

This is the second time I give Elite a chance and again I go dead in the game after about 5-6 tutorials. I thought Odyssey was a must to get the full experience, so this time I bought It and regretted it quickly. That DLC turns the game into a shooter and a walk-around-simulator, pulls you away from the space game I wanted to play and it tanked my FPS by more than HALF!! WTF!? Like it was made by a diferent company!? Then I spent the next 3 hours trying to fiddle with my pc, optimizing, even upgrading the BIOS in the hope the RAM's would become a bit faster. It did give me 20 fps more, but on lowest possible settings and only 1200 resolution. So it was too late for a refund and I actually wanted to learn and play the game. But not knowing anything and having to watch youtube videos for every little aspect of the game just took all the juice out of me.

The manual hauling of flying ore (or the stupid art of trying to catch the lump of flying metal into the basket of the cargo bay with your ship) was the last straw...Lol. What ever happened to a simple tractor beam when mining like in all other space games? Why does this game insist on being so damn difficult? 5 different in-cockpit-screens to mange ship, quests, economy and so on? So many keys and combinations to remember just to go from A to B and land the damn ship! And I thought Eve Online was difficult to get into for new players? Ha... I was wrong. This one takes the bad cake.

Uninstalled and forgotten already.

183848760.review:
What an awesome game, honestly has everything i wanted from star citizen, just without the constant bugs that keeps you from doing ANYTHING. The amount of stuff you can do is pretty wild, all kinds of things to loot, cut open, hack, download, break into, steal. 

     Only .5% of the galaxy has been explored because its literally a 1 : 1 ratio of our own milky way galaxy... when you get in and look at the galaxy map your mind will be blown. they even have a shuttle system that's basically a taxi that will bring you pretty much anywhere and drop you off a specific location you choose, which i thought was kinda neat. you can equip whats called a "fuel scoop" and when your hopping from system to system exploring, you can orbit around a sun once or twice in super cruise mode (its really quick) and your fuel scoop will turn that energy into fuel to fill up so you dont have to land and refuel every how ever many systems, saves A TON of time! 

     I also just found out that you can sign up for a "faction war" (which is a fps tdm basically) in systems that are in a war or civil war state, and when you do, a shuttle will pick you up, bring you to the combat zone, and then when its over bring you back to the station... how cool is that?!??
     
     You can even land on a planet, go out in your SRV land vehicle, and then send your ship OUT TO ORBIT where it just cruises around out there until you tell it to come back and pick you up.... theres just so many things its hard to list them all XD 

     All of the systems you go to you can "discover" all of the the planets and such in them, then sell that cartographer info to stations later on for a good amount of cash as well, so the more you explore and discover, the more money youll get!
you also have ranks and reputation for all the different contacts and factions as well, its pretty in depth, i think if more people knew the amount of stuff this game had to offer now a days it would be WAY more popular, im honestly really impressed so far

183758081.review:
Elite Dangerous is an absolutely stunning game, and the depth it offers is unparalleled. The vastness of the galaxy, the freedom to explore, trade, fight, or even just hang out in space, is a dream for anyone who’s ever wanted to be a part of a living, breathing universe. The graphics are amazing, the attention to detail is impressive, and there's always something new to discover.

That being said, Elite Dangerous is definitely a game that demands a lot of time and patience. The learning curve can be steep, especially for new players. The controls, mechanics, and the sheer scale of the game can feel overwhelming at first, and it can take a while to truly grasp all the nuances. But once you get past the initial hurdles, the rewards are incredibly satisfying.

It’s also worth noting that the game’s pace can feel slow, especially if you're used to more action-packed titles. You’ll spend a lot of time mining, trading, or just flying between systems, which is great for immersion, but not necessarily for those looking for a quick fix.

Overall, if you’re willing to invest the time and effort, Elite Dangerous offers an experience unlike any other. It’s not for everyone, but if you’re patient and love the idea of exploring the stars, this game is a masterpiece.

183716397.review:
和“飞船操作”这坨 [h3]卡嗓子的臭屎[/h3] 相比，[b]前世代垃圾渲染[/b]，[b]完全半成品的人类姿态交互[/b]和[b]彻底摆烂的新手教程[/b]在这2.7小时的流程里已经能被我勉强适应了。我从未在任何游戏里见过这么蹩脚的飞行系统和操纵方式，从HUD到键位再到运行机制全方位劝退。如果你是为了开飞船而来，最好三思。

首先最重要的一点，即使在单人模式（Go Solo）也[b]没有任何形式的暂停[/b]。如果你刚结束教程，准备驾船起飞却在空中忘记了某个操作——那恭喜你，你完蛋啦。在你手忙脚乱尝试键位或者Esc切出菜单的过程中，飞船的飞行不会停止，直到你意识到这点赶紧切回来，或者在最坏的情况下直接撞毁。相信我，这种情况（指忘记操作）基本一定会发生，因为教程[b]不留痕迹地跳过了大量非常重要的键位[/b]，包括收放起落架(L)和打开大灯(Ins)。

其次也很重要的一点，飞船操作一坨。我暂时没有找到哪里能改掉这个愚蠢至极的[b]横移光标进行桶滚[/b]的操作方式。说实话必须通过追踪光标来进行俯仰已经够愚蠢了，左右移动光标却又不是俯仰而是桶滚简直超乎想象。我是在玩他妈的王牌空战吗我请问了，为什么在[b]星际旅行[/b]中“桶滚”会是一个比左右旋转更高频，更重要的选项啊？
不过，操作的问题很有可能只是我的问题，也许从正经空战游戏来的玩家不会在乎这巨大的不快。但就算是这些玩家，也得听听另一件事： 在查看飞船内HUD菜单时，你始终不会放开操纵。
这是什么意思？意思是你在飞行途中想要看看任务栏，把视线从前风挡上移开（物理）时，[b]你的光标依然在操作飞船，让它如陀螺般旋转起来。[/b]  键盘操作会被正常隔离（键盘在这时会用来操作HUD菜单本身），为什么鼠标不能？除了傻篮子制作组十年来都不觉得这是个问题甚至十年来都没用键鼠玩过这烂游戏以外，我想不出别的解释。

最后没那么重要的一点，跃迁功能怎么玩怎么像半成品。所谓的质量加速器只有一个，跨星系旅行和星系内加速都按同一个键，然后让系统[b]纯看心情[/b]加速到光速或者维持在数千km/s。如果你还没有意识到这会带来什么问题也没关系，让游戏内不管不顾地在环绕巨行星的轨道上加速到0.4C的飞船和机头指向数光年外却维持在200km/s速度的苦苦等待来告诉你吧。然后这个跃迁系统在脱离之后还有一个数十秒的[b]半强制冷却时间[/b]。如果你通过误操作或者遇到了下面马上要讲的狗屎情况从跃迁中脱离，就必须面对打断心流的罚站时间或者冒着飞船损伤（别忘了你还不一定知道修复或重置飞船系统的键位呢，教程不教的）的风险强制重启。祝你开心。
好了，刚才说的打断跃迁的狗屎情况是什么呢？其实也没有很多，我遇到的比较有迹可循的问题包括[b]在没有提示，完全黑暗的行星背阳面被拉入大气层[/b]，以及[b]遇到行星环[/b]。没有错，拥有护盾且能以光速旅行的飞船对相对论竖起鄙夷的中指，并用尖锐的警报提醒驾驶员它在极高速度下质量也不变，所以会害怕这些连陨石都可能算不上的小冰晶。主打真实（憋笑

以上，退款跑路。即使这游戏很有深度，我也不在乎了。从无人深空到X4，我以为我起码已经学会了星际旅行，我错了。

183677864.review:
Also ich hab dem Spiel nach ner Weile nochmal ne Chance gegeben, aber es krankt an den selben Krankheiten an denen alle Weltraumspiele kranken:

400 Mrd. Sternensysteme mit 380 Mio Planeten... (das ist kein Witz: das Spiel hat laut Entwickler Frontier wirklich so viele) aber es gibt einfach kein Ziel. Du wirst reingeworfen mit bestenfalls oberflächlichen Tutorials und darfst ein Gameplaysystem der Qualitätsstufe Raketeningenieur lernen. Für Neulinge ist dieses Spiel eine Lebensaufgabe. Kurz: das Spiel ist nur für echte Fanboys des stumpfsinnigen Dauergrindings ohne jegliche Belohnungseffekte etwas.

Wer hier die Unkompliziertheit eines No Mans Sky oder eine brauchbare Story wie aus Mass Effect bzw. Everspace 2 erwartet, sollte hier einen großen Bogen machen. Es ist eh faszinierend, dass man diese Spiele in einem Atemzug nennt, weil Sie nahezu gar nichts miteinander zu tun haben (außer dass sie im Weltraum spielen).

Wer stattdessen total darauf abfährt 4 Wochen lang Tutorials zu googeln, 4 Jahre zu grinden und dann irgendwann kurz vor der Altersschwäche endlich mal all das Material und die Credits zusammen zu haben, um kreativ werden zu können, der ist hier genau richtig.

Ihr solltet aber wirklich KEINE anderen Hobbies und auch kein Leben haben - das spiel ist nämlich zeitraubender als jedes MMORPG.

Das Spiel ist sicher nicht verkehrt, aber wer weder Zeit noch Energie hat sich mit Pseudo-Quantenphysik zu beschäftigen, der lässt besser die Finger von diesem Spiel. Für alle anderen ist es ein gutes Spiel um sinn- und ziellos im Weltraum herumzufliegen. Wem X4 zu kompliziert und No Mans Sky zu simpel ist, hat in Elite Dangerous ein gesundes Mittelmaß gefunden.

Just got this game, i bought it in the winter sale 2024 with a 75% discount, totally worth it. Though i don't think i would buy it in it's normal price. Not saying the game is overpriced, it's actually a good price for the ammount of content the game has, but it's always better to wait for a discount.

If you are a space fan, this game is for you. This is a 1:1 replica of the Milky Way, and every star you see in the sky is not painted in a skybox, they are actually there and you can visit them, along with their planets(yes this includes our own solar system). Also, you are not alone. There are space stations, planetary bases, space empires and other real players for you to interact with, and countless missions for you to earn money to buy better ships and stuff. There's also a space police btw, and i got a space fine in my first hour of gameplay. 10/10.
